title: Integer lattice
summary: In mathematics, the n-dimensional integer lattice (or cubic lattice), denoted Z n {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} ^{n}} , is the lattice in the Euclidean space R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} whose lattice points are n-tuples of integers. The two-dimensional integer lattice is also called the square lattice, or grid lattice. Z n {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} ^{n}} is the simplest example of a root lattice. The integer lattice is an odd unimodular lattice.
